location: A GRIMY RESIDENTIAL STREET, NEW YORK CITY

text: Deserted except for A FEW SLEEPING BUMS. FAVOR AN APARTMENT FLAT.
THE CAMERA ANGLES UP the body of MARIA, asleep in bed, ly top of her sheets. Maria, a 17 year-old Italian with blea blonde hair, wears an oversized t-shirt that clings to he exquisite body.

head_text.subj: PLAYING FULL BLAST ON THE RADIO.

text: Maria slaps the buzzer off, gets out of bed and crosses t bedroom window.
(yelling, Bronx Italian) Maria! Turn that radio down! Maria ignores the voice. With her back to the camera, Mar the windw and pulls off her t-shirt. She turns her head t door.

(yelling) Today's the day I go to camp! During the following dialogue, Maria crosses to her dress pulls out a pair of shorts, crosses to the closet and get t-shirt then checks under hthe bed for her shoes. During all her actions, THE CAMERA FOLLOWS BEHIND HER, ma sure that at no time do we see Maria's chest.
(yelling) Ma! Ya hear me? I'm goin' to that camp today.
(yelling) Yeah I heard ya. Whaddya want me to do about it?
Aren't ya gonna walk me to the bus or anything?
(yelling) At 6:30 in the fucken' mornin'? Walk yourself. And turn down that noise!
(yelling) Hey. Shuddup.
(yelling) No. _You_ shuddup.
(yelling) You _both_ shuddup! I'm goin' to camp, and I may never come back!
(yelling in unison)
Maria turns angrily to the door. As she does, we get a quick view of her bare chest. Maria breast has been tattooed with the word "MILK." Her left h tattooed with the word "SHAKE."

Maria, in tight shorts and a cut-off "I LOVE NEW YORK" t- walks down the deserted street. She carries a battered du and sleeping bag. In the b.g. a black dump truck appears. Maria pays no attention to it. The dump truck, gaining speed, ROARS AHEAD. Only the outl the driver can be seen. HEARING, Maria turns to look. The truck runs over the street's curb onto the sidewalk.
What the hell - The truck heads straight towards Maria.
shit! Maria runs. The truck follows. Maria, panicked, turns into an alley.
Maria runs down the alley as the truck turns in and follo Maria runs to the end of the alley. A dead end. Maria SCREAMS. The truck roars at her, full speed.
The truck smashes her into the brick wall.
parked on the street, lifting up a dumpster.
in the dumpster. The body gets dumped into the trash-fil truck.

It has been a year since we have last seen her. Angela, n gets out of the garbage truck and runs across the street city bus picking up PASSENGERS. Dressed in jeans and a clean, new "I LOVE NEW YORK" t-shi carries a small pink suitcase and a pink sleeping bag. He has been cut and dyed blonde, similar to Maria's. Just before she boards the bus, she turns and looks at th garbage truck.
being compacted with the garbage.
Formally known as Camp Rolling Hills. Upperstate New York September.
a pretty woman in her mid 30's, smiling directly into the Tawny wears an expensive, coordinated outfit. She holds a microphone with a WMGH logo.

Hi. I'm Tawny Richards with the WMGH newsteam. We're at Camp New Horizons, where an autumn retreat called "An experiment in Sharing" is about to begin. Let's meet the owners of the camp, Herman and Lilly Miranda.

Tawny and her ASSORTED TELEVISION CREW cross to HERMAN AN MIRANDA, who stand beneath a large banner saying "AN EXPE IN SHARING - CAMP NEW HORIZONS." Lilly, short and somewha is in her mid 40's. Herman, about two inches shorter than seems a few years older. Both wear Camp New Horizons t-s Herman also sports tight jeans, boots, and a belt with a Playboy insignia on the buckle. Lilly wears flowery short sandals. On either side of Herman and Lilly stand TWO GROUPS OF TE who we will meet in a moment. The first group looks very affluent; the other group looks poor and streetwise. Ange the latter group, stands a bit off to the side of them. S dressed as we saw her this morning. Herman gives his best smile to Tawny as Lilly stares into WMGH camera.
Herman, tell us about this wonderfully unique program.
Well, Tawny, we've brung together two specially chosen groups of teens from all over America. One group comes from upper class homes while the other comes from our low class establishments.
Lilly, what do you wish to accomplish?
In our own little way we'd like to promote harmony, peace, love, sharing, and a better understanding between the rich and poor.
That's wonderful. Let's meet the kids. CINDY, a beautiful 17 year-old brunetter dressed in Ralph casual, steps forward. Her Southern accent could melt but
Hi, y'all. I'm Cindy Hammersmith from Peachtree, Georgia. Next is GREG, a friendly-looking 17 year-old Japanese boy dressed in beach shorts and an Hawaiian shirt.
Greg Nakashima. Westwood, California. Tawny turns to JAN, an exotic-looking Hispanic 16 year-o dressed in an expensive khaki outfit that shows off her b body.
Jan Hernandez. Palm View, Arizona. PETER, a pudgy black 14 year-old dressed in a Polo shirt plaid shorts, is next.
Peter Doyle. Houston Heights, Texas. Tawny turns to BOBBY, a white 15 year-old dressed in a ye button-down short-sleeved shirt and bright green green go shorts. He grins broadly.

Bobby Stark. Western Springs, Illinois. Home of the Western Springs Wildcats! Last, but not least, is MARCIA, a pretty blonde 16 year-o dressed in a colorful t-shirt and shorts. Her slight nerv makes her all the more appealing.
Marsha Holland. Defiance, Ohio. Tawny crosses over to the other group.
And let's see who we have over here - She turns to ARAB a gorgeous 17 year-old Asian female wea black leather biker gear.
Arab. San Francisco.
Do you have a last name, Arab? Arab gives her a dark look.
No. Tawny doesn't push it.
Okay. Tawny moves to SNOWBOY, a thin 16 year old white male wea torn blue jeans, a Grateful Dead t-shirt, and a "Foreign hat. He also sports a tattoo of a skull on his bicep.
Snowboy. Chicago. Next is ANITA, a pretty yet tough black 16 year-old dress old jeans and a worn plaid workshift.
Anita Burcham. Sawtelle Gap, Kentucky. Tawny turns to RIFF, a muscular black 17 year-old male dr jeans and a muscle t-shirt.
Riff. Detroit. TONY, a handsome, well-built 17 year-old Hispanic dressed jeans and a white t-shirt is next.
Tony DeHerrara. East L.A. Tawny then turns to Angela, who has been admiring Tony.
And what's your name, honey?
Maria. Maria Nicastro.
And where are you from, Maria?
All over. Right now New York. Tawny studies Angela a moment, then turns and smiles into WMGH camera.
Wonderful. What great kids.
standing next to each other.
(whispering) That Tony's cute. Cindy gives her a look.
He's _Mexican_. Marcia tries not to react to Cindy's comment.
She suddenly becomes quite serious as she looks into the camera.

Ironically, Camp New Horizons was formerly known as Camp Rolling Hills, where last year nineteen people were brutally slain by alleged psychopath Angela Baker. Baker, known as the "Angel of Death," was also allegedly responsible for another string of grisly murders seven years ago at nearby Camp Arawak, which has since closed down. Lilly pops her head in.
But things have changed here! We're under new ownership! Tawny throws Lilly a look, then turns to her crew.
Stop tape. We're outta here. Tawny crosses over to the SOUND MAN and gives him the mic Lilly, worried, follows behind her.
I thought we agreed you wouldn't talk about those murders.
You gotta give the people what they want. Violence sells. (to the crew) See you Monday morning, boys.  Turning, she spots Angela.
You look a little older than the others.
Massive drugs. Tawny looks around a moment to make sure no one is listen
(whispering) Speaking of - do you know where I could get some coke? I need about a half a gram. It's been a shit of a day - know what I mean? Angela reacts. Then:
I'll be right back.

head_text.subj: A KITCHEN DRAWER BEING PULLED OPEN.

text: Inside is a box of plastic sandwhich bags alongside rolls aluminum foil and plastic wrap. Angela's hand snatches a baggie.
on a wooden shelf filled with other bathroom products. An hand grabs the cleaner.
as Angela pours some of the cleaner into the baggie.
One of the many dangers of being a drug addict is never really knowing if the stuff is pure.
Angela and Tawny stand near to Tawny's porsche. Angela ho the filled baggie. Tawny, nervous, quickly grabs it.
This is way too much.
It's a gift. You're my favorite newscaster.
Good stuff?
(nodding) It'll really clean your pipes. Tawny climbs into the Porsche.
(sarcastically) Happy camping!
Thanks. Have a good life. The Porsche ROARS TO LIFE.
(under her breath) What's left of it.
speeding down the road.
looking into the rear-view mirror. She smiles. No one aro
as it turns on to an unpaved forest road.
as she parks the car several yeards from the main road. S the contents of the baggie into a large pile on her dashb She then takes a small straw out of her coat pocket.

Ready or not, here I come! She lets out a deep breath, positions the straw, and snor majority of the white powder up her nose.  Tawny instantly reacts. She coughs. Gags. Tries to blow it out of her nose. The only thing that com is blood. Tawny opens her mouth. A bubbling, bloody substance eats it. She leans over the side of the car and retches. Then massive ammount of blood, parts of her esophagus and stom lining. But it's soon over. Slumping over the side of the Porsche, she dies.
A string of firecrackers EXPLODES at her feet. She looks up to see Peter watching and GIGGLING as he run the dining hall, dodging the other campers who file insid
(to Angela) It's just a firecracker. (laughing) You city brats should be used to things like that! Angela tries to calm down.

The dining hall, like the rest of the camp, seems neglect Several of the folding chairs are stacked against the wal of the tables have also been stacked up. The bare walls a windows add to the gloom. Lilly GREETS the campers as they enter AND ASKS THEM TO T SEAT. Almost everyone takes a table for themselves. Marsha approaches Tony's table.
Can I sit here?
It's not my table. Marsha smiles and sits down a few seats away from Tony. T studies her a moment, then turns away. Bobby crosses to a table occupied by Arab. He gives her a grin. She ignores him.
Hi! Bobby Stark. Mind if I sit with you?
Drop dead, fag. Bobby crosses to a table occupied by Riff. Next to Riff a blaster PLAYS A RAP SONG.
Hi! Bobby Stark. Bobby points to a nearby seat.
This seat taken? Riff pulls out a switchblade, pops it open and flings it.
imbedding itself in the middle of the seat.
smiling and backing away.
Cool, man. No sweat, man. Bobby crosses to Angela's table.
Hi. Bobby Stark. Want some company? Angela smiles.
Sure.
(a little surprised) Cool. He sits down.
Your name's Maria Nicastro, right?
How'd you remember?
I'm great with names. That's how I got to be Senior Class President of my high school!
That's nice. Bobby gives her another of his famous grins.
So you're underprivileged, huh? Angela reacts.
CLAPPING HER HANDS to get everyone's attention.
Okay, everybody! It's time to get started! She turns to Riff and points to his portable beat box.
Do you think you could turn that off? Riff gives her an icy stare.
Please? Riff stares a moment longer, then TURNS OFF THE MUSIC.
Thanks. Herman's going to hand out camp t-shirts for everyone to wear. That way we'll all look the same and we won't feel different. Action lets out a small LAUGH. Herman starts handing out shirts.

As soon as out third counselor arrives, we'll be splitting up into three groups. Then we'll stay in the groups for three days. During that time each group will be camping out in the woods. And we'll get to know and understan each other as best we can. Cindy raises her hand.
Excuse me!
Yes, Cindy?
What do y'all mean by campin' out?
You know. Sleeping in tents, cooking our own food, hiking -
Where do we go to the bathroom and take showers?
There's outdoor toilets near our camping sites. And we'll be washing up in the lake.
You're kiddin.'
No. We ain't.
What kinda food we gonna have?
Fish, mostly. We'll be catching them. Several of the kids react.
Fish are good for you. Besides,  we've got to watch our budget. After you've spent three days in the small groups, we'll come back together for the last two. Any other questions?
Yeah. Do the guys get to sleep with the girls?
(laughing) No.
Why not?
Because. You know.
No. I don't. Tell me.
They're afraid we'll _fuck_. Lilly decides it's time to change the subject.
Why don't we all loosen up with a good, old fashioned camp song. Does anyone know "The Happy Camper" song? Angela raises her hand, excited.
I do! Most of the campers turn and react. SFX: A CAR DRIVING UP O.S.
That must be Barney.
(laughing) _Barney_?
Barney Rubble.  Everyone LAUGHS.

An old model Mustang, driven by BARNEY WHITMORE, pulls up parks next to Herman and Lilly's Jeep. In his early 40's, Barney is a handsome, solidly built man. He wears jeans a polo shirt. Barney exits the car and crosses to the dining hall entra
Barney enters.
Everybody - I'd like you to meet our third counselor, Officer Barney Whitmore. Barney nods hello to the campers. Snowboy slumps. him. Arab and Riff sneer.
looking at Barney. She is not happy.
Sorry I'm late. I guess I'll have to catch up on all your names later.
Are you a cop?
Yep. Riff BELCHES. Barney ignores him.
That's one of the reasons I'm here. To make sure there's no trouble. RIFF BELCHES AGAIN. LOUDER. Arab and Snowboy LAUGH. Tony studies
(to Riff) Hey. You got a problem? Riff turns to him. Pause.
Suck my dick, spic.
Tony jumps from the table and quickly flattens Riff on th ground, sending chairs flying along the way. Riff yanks out his switchblade. It flies open in Tony's f
You're dead, spic. An arm suddenly wraps around Riff's neck, as a hand swift twists Riff's hand with the knife, forcing him to drop it
as Barney, with a chokehold on Riff, slams Riff into a ta

Any more shit like this and I'll send your butt to jail so fast you won't know what happened. You got it? Riff nods. Barney releases his hold on Riff, then picks u switchblade. He closes it and pockets it.
(to the grouo) Anybody else carrying anything? Give it to me now. Cause the same goes for you that goes for him. (to Riff) Sit down and behave yourself. Riff obeys.
(whispering) This is better than t.v.!  On Angela's reaction:
Angela's cabin from last year. Lilly, with her clipboard, stands in front. She checks her watch.
(shouting) Hurry up, girls! We've got a lot to do!

in a fashionable satin bra and panties, as she crosses to bathroom carrying a makeup case. THE CAMERA FOLLOWS HER u Han, nude from the waist up, exits the bathroom and passe Cindy. THE CAMERA THEN FOLLOWS JAN to a bed, where she picks up New Horizons t-shirt. In the b.g. Anita, in a simple cott bra, changes into her camp t-shirt.

(to Jan) Gimme a shirt, will ya? Jan grabs another t-shirt on the bed and crosses to Arab, WITH THE CAMERA FOLLOWING. As Jan reaches Arab, Arab peel off her black t-shirt. She is nude underneath. Angela, still wearing her "I LOVE NEW YORK" t-shirt, sits on a bed directly in back of Arab and Jan. She glances up two pairs of breasts in front of her face, then quickly l back down to the floor. Angela takes off her "I LOVE NEW YORK" t-shirt, revealing very heavy, ultra-conservative white cotton bra.
(noticing) How do ya get _that_ thing off? With a can opener? Angela quickly slips on her camp t-shirt as Arab and Jan LAUGH.
Hey - look at this.
in her camp t-shirt, as she walks into the empty counsel room. Scrawled on the walls are "ANGELA BAKER = THE
SLEPT HERE," "THE ANGEL OF DEATH MUST DIE," and "FUCK ANG BAKER." Also on the walls are crude pictures of Angela supposedly killing people. Marcia is disgusted and a litt firghtened by what she sees.
How weird. It's that girl who killed everybody. Angela Baker. Anita, Jan and Arab, dressed in their t-shirts, enter. Th reactions are similar to Marcia's.
as she listens. Cindy, still in her panties and bra, rush to join the other girls.
Yuck! These drawings are so gross! ANITA (0.S. They should've told us about this.
You think anybody could come here if they did? Shit, you're dumber than you look.
turning to Cindy.
How much did they charge _you_ to come here, rich girl?
I dunno. Three thousand bucks I think.
God. I bet the fucking government paid 'em at least that much for us. "An experiment in Sharing," my ass. We're here cause they can't get anybody else.
listening.
And we've got some crazy asshole named Angela Baker to thank for it. Angela flashes Arab an angry look.
Angela, in camp t-shirt, exits the cabin to see Barney at bottom of the stairs checking Arab's driver's license. Angela tries to sneak by.
(to Angela) Hold it. I need to see some i.d. Angela looks at him a moment. Then reaches into her pocke pulls out a driver's license. Arab exits as Barney takes Angela's license.
saying "Maria Nicastro" with Angela's picture. The birthd reads "July 28, 1972." The hair reads "blonde."
No offense, but you look like you've been through a lot in 17 years.
I have.
I hope you have a good time here, Maria.
Thanks. He gives her back the license. Lilly crosses to Barney wi xeroxed map.

(to Barney) Here's your map. Angela crosses to the other kids. All have changed into New Horizons t-shirts, although Riff has rolled his sleev to accentuate his muscles and Cindy has tied the bottom o t-shirt to make it look more cute. In the b.g. Herman sor various camping equipment into three different piles. Lilly turns to the campers.
Now pay attention! When you hear your name, go stand next to your counselor. She looks down at her clipboard.
Arab, Bobby, Riff and Cindy will be with me. Lilly's group isn't very excited about Lilly or each othe They reluctantly cross her.
Peter, Jan, Maria and Snowboy will be with Herman. Peter, Snowboy and Jan start crossing to Herman. Angela s with the others.
Maria - Angela, realizing Lilly is talking to her, crosses to her group. In the b.g. Herman points his Playboy buckle in Ja direction and scams her.
That leaves Marsha, Tony, Anita and Greg with Barney. Marsha grins at Tony, who grins shyly back. Angela notice She can't help but feel a little jealous. Tony's cute.
I hope everybody learns a lot in the next three days. And when we come back together, I gaurantee it won't be the same.
reacting.

Barney leads Marsha, Tony, Anita and Greg out of the wood the clearing. Each carry their backpack and sleeping bags Marsha and Tony also carry an ice chest between them whil Anita and Greg carry the tent supplies and fishing poles. Barney carries a large box full of various camping items.
Here we are.
Home sweet home!
Why don't we put everything down and rest a second. The campers, grateful for the break, quickly drop everyth and sit down.
I thought we'd never make it.
It wasn't so bad. Back home we've got hills like this all over.
So do we. The Hollywood Hills. Right, Tony?
I guess.
Who's hungry? Everyone but Tony AD LIBS that they are.

We're supposed to catch fish. And we will - maybe tommorow. But I thought you might enjoy something else tonight. He opens up the chest. It is filled with hamburger meat, hotdogs, condiments, buns, and a variety of soda. Everyone APPROVES.
I know I'm bending the rules a bit, but hey -
(deadpan) You can do it. You're a cop. Silence. An uncomfortable moment.
I'm doing it because when I had the chance to do it with my own son, I didn't.
How old is he?
Sean would have been seventeen. he was murdered here last year.
God. I'm sorry.
You didn't know. Pause.
And I'm sorry for giving you a hard time.
It's okay. I'm used to it. I cop, remember? ma Everyone LAUGHS.
Who wants a soda? THEY ALL AD LIB THAT THEY DO. Barney tosses sodas to his campers.
Slicing through the air...  And landing on a log, chopping the log in two.

with an ax. Beside her are several other pieces of choppe wood. In the b.g. Peter sits by the tents, sorting his firecrackers. Angela picks up a piece of wood and carries it over to a being startled by Herman. Jan stands nearby with a handfu kindling.
(to Angela) Where'd you learn to chop wood?
I've never chopped wood before. But I've chopped other things.
Let me know when you want these sticks, Mr. Miranda.
Anytime now, sweatpea. Herman gives her a fond pat on the rear as he gets up.
And call me Herman. Herman turns to Snowboy and Peter.
Where's Snowboy?
I dunno.
(shouting) Snowboy!
Snowboy, spray-painting his gang's logo on a tree with a can of red spraypaint, turns.
(shouting)  Yeah?
(shouting) Time to go fishing! Snowboy stuffs the can down the front of his jeans.
Snowboy enters from the woods.
(to Herman) Do we have to?
We gotta eat, don't we?
I hate fish. Herman playfully touches her nose.
Hey, that's no way to talk. Jan, pouting, crosses and exits into a tent. Herman turns to the other three.
You guys each grab a pole and some bait. I'll meet you at the lake in a few minutes. Herman crosses over to the tent.
Come out, sweetpea. Daddy won't make you fish if you don't wanna. He turns to the other campers and winks.
Peter and Angela fish on the lake's shore. Showboy, trying hard to be cool, tries to put a worm on h fishing hook. He can't do it. Angela notices.
(to Snowboy) Here. Without any hesitation, she takes the worm and deftly spi on the hook. Snowboy reacts to her skill.
You'll get used to it. After a while, it's kinda fun. Pause on Snowboy studies Angela. Then:
Trip out. He casts a line.
as he takes a firecracker out of his pocket and sticks it a fish's mouth. Neither Angela nor Snowboy notice.
Herman should've been here by now. What's taking him so long?
He's tryin' to get into that rich skank's pants. Peter fishes around in his pocket and pulls out a lighter
That's disgusting.
I wouldn't mind havin' a piece of her myself. Peter lights a firecracker.
turning to Peter. Realizing:
Blood and fish guts fly into her face. She is not happy.
(to Peter) Hey, dude. Lemme try. Angela tries to wipe away the mess on her face and clothe she quickly exits.
As Angela enters the clearing, she HEARS GIGGLING from in the two-man tent. Angela pulls back the flap to reveal Jan, nude, and Herma naked from the waist up, pulling down his jeans. Jan noti Angela.
We've got company. Herman turns.
oh, shit. Angela drops the flap.
Jan GIGGLES and looks for her clothes. Herman wiggles int jeans as he crawls to the front of the tent.
(shouting) Hey, Maria - we can work something out can't we? My old lady just don't give it to me no more. You understand, don'tcha?
as he exits the tent.
Ready for a weenie roast?

head_text.subj: A TREE BRANCH HELD BY ANGELA

text: about one and a half inches thick; it's tip on fire. Angela shoves the flaming branch into Herman's crotch.
SCREAMING in agony. The burning branch is suddenly jammed into his open mouth
topless, as she peers through the tent. Realizing, she SCREAMS, then quickly pushes past Angela a runs into the woods.
Put on a bra. Angela runs after her.
as a terrified Jan runs through the woods. She suddenly stops.
Angela is in front of her, holding a large branch.
You have a lousy sense of direction. Jan SCREAMS. Angela takes the branch and BASHES it into Jan's head.

head_text.subj: A FISH GETTING ITS HEAD CHOPPED OFF

text: as Angela starts scaling and cleaning the fish. Peter wat He takes the severed fish head and plays with it.
When are Herman and Jan coming back?
Not for a long time. But before he left he said we should go to bed early. We've got a big day tomorrow. Peter throws the fish head at Angela.
You brat. Peter gives Angela the finger, then runs into the woods. Angela's had it. She turns to Snowboy who stands behind a
Snowboy! I need help.
I'm busy.
Doing what?
Makin' art. Angela crosses to Snowboy.

head_text.subj: ANGELA'S P.0.V. SNOWBOY'S GANG LOGO SPRAYPAINTED ON THE T

text: Beneathe it he spraypaints "SNOWBOY".
And trip out on this - He proudly turns and points into the woods.
spray-painted with gang graffiti.
disgusted.
Bombs away!
A lit firecracker lands next to them. It EXPLODES.
Angela jumps. Snowboy LAUGHS.
I warned you. As if inspired by the firecracker, Snowboy spraypaints wi designs all over the tent.
slowly shaking her head.
(to herself) Why'd I think this year would be any different?

Barney's campsite looks neat and efficient. Next to the t tents a small portable table holds the sodas, bags of chi hamburger buns, etc. Barney, Greg, Anita and Marsha sit around a campfire, eat their hamburgers and hotdogs as Tony scrapes the grill wi spatula.
This is one of the best burgers I ever ate!
So's mine. Thanks for cooking, Tony. The others ALSO THANK TONY.
No problem.  Marsha gets up and grabs a nearby flashlight.
Excuse me a second. I've got to use the outhouse. (to Tony) And it has nothing to do with you burgers! Everyone LAUGHS.
Tony, go with her.
I'll be all right.
Maybe so. But I don't want you to go alone. Tony crosses to Marsha.
I wanna go.
Sorry. You get to start pitching the tents. Greg reacts. Anita LAUGHS.
Marsha and Tony walk down a narrow path. flashlight in front of them.
That's so awful about Barney's son.
God. I know.
I never would have come here if I knew about all this. Would you?
Probably not. But I'm glad I'm out of L.A. She LAUGHS. Marsha shines the  A TWIG SNAPS. Tony stops. Listens.
You hear that? Marsha stops.
What?
Something in the woods.
No. They start walking again.
Tony stops.
Give me the flashlight. Marsha gives it to him. Tony shines the flashlight into t woods. Nothing. SFX: THE BRUSH MOVES AGAIN. Tony swiftly moves the flashl towards the noise.
Who's out there?
Tony movies the flashlight in another direction.
Who is it? What do you want? ANOTHER TWIG SNAPS. Tony, nervous, GASPS.
as SOMETHING leaps out.
Then looks. Realizes.
It looks at Tony and Marsha then scampers back into the w
Marsha looks at Tony. She giggles. Then bursts out LAUGHI Tony grins. Marsha tries to get serious, but she can't.
Stop it! As Marsha continues laughing, they continue down the path
Angela peeks through the trees, watching them.
being dragged by Angela towards Peter and Snowboy's tent.
It's a good thing you're dead. In a couple of years, your breasts would've been sagging something terrible.
Angela drags Jan's body into the tent. She looks towards back of the tent.
Asleep.
as Angela continues to drag in the body
Snowboy changes position. THE CAMERA FOLLOWS HIS HAND as on something. WE ANGLE OUT to see that it now rests on th of Herman's body that has been propped up next to Snowboy
A huge firecracker is stuffed into his left nostril. Anot is stuffed into his right.
(whispering to Peter) Didn't anyone teach you that there's nothing "cool" about explosives?
Their fuses are lit.
He wakes up. And sees. But it's too late to do anything a it.
as the firecrackers EXPLODE, sending blood and little pie Peter flying into her face.
Snowboy, waking up, does not yet realize what has happene
(annoyed) Hey, dude - He turns and sees what is left of Peter's head.
She holds a can of Snowboy's red spraypaint.
Hey dude. Rad spraypaint. Mind if I try?
as Angela sprays the spraypaint on his face.

Snowboy tries to fight back, but Angela keeps the spraypa coming. Angela slowly inches in. The fumes and the paint become t for Snowboy. His face literally drips with paint. Angela holds a lighter up to his face. Ignites it.
Snowboy's paint-covered face goes up in flames.
HUMMING to herself, Angela exits the burning tent. She cr a stick loaded with several marshmallows lying on a marsh bag. She grabs the stick and holds it over the ever-increasing

Lilly's campsite is the former location of the abandoned where Angela stored several campers' bodies during last y reign of terror. Now only a pile of boards remain where the cabin used to The outhouse trench has been filled in. The only recogniz fixture from the area is the old barbecue pit, which rema intact. Lilly and her campers sit around the barbecue pit, silent eating a breakfast that looks something like mush. They look up to see Angela enter. Angela carries her suit sleeping bag and Berman's map. Her camp t-shirt is somewh wrinkled, but clean.
What are you doing here?
I'm supposed to switch with someone from this group. Herman said so.
(a little miffed) I wish he wouldn't do things like that.
So who's the lucky shithead you're supposed to switch with? Angela throws Arab a look.
You.
Angela leads the way through the woods as Arab, with her follows sullenly behind her.
How old are you, anyway?
Seventeen.
You look older.
I know. When I was young, our town's water supply didn't have any fluoride.
You're one weird motherfucker.
Angela and Arab enter from the woods. With the exception one tent and no campers in sight, everything seems normal
Where's the other tent?
It got sort of wrecked. We're all in one now.
All right!
In fact, I think they're in there now. Arab crosses to the tent, THE CAMERA FOLLOWING.
(yelling) Anybody home? Arab sticks her head in the tent.
as she looks into the tent.
completely empty.
They're not here.
Angela kicks Arab in the rear, causing Arab to fall into tent.
Arab angry, picks herself up.
You bitch. That hurt!
as her head pops out of the tent.
Don't you ever -
swiftly landing on the.back of Arab's neck.
as Arab's severed head hits and rolls across the grass.
Angela enters from the woods, seeing Lilly, Cindy, Bobby sitting in a circle.
Maria! Come join us! Angela crosses to them. She sits between Cindy and Riff. gives her a quick cool smile that basically says "You are Riff gives her a "You are shit" frown.
I call this our "Sharing and Caring" time. For instance, what's your favorite movie?
How nice. How about- you, Riff?
Ones with tits and blood.
(to Riff) Why do we have to listen to those stupid rap tapes? I mean, who likes that stuff anymore?
Fuck you.
Now, Riff -
(interrupting) Rap is a helluva lot better than that country shit.
I never said I liked country. But I'd rather listen to that than a bunch of darkies who can't sing. Riff spits in her face.
Riff! Cindy, shocked and angry, wipes off the spit. Then looks with undisguised hatred.
You dirty nigger. Riff jumps up and starts strangling Cindy.
Riff! Stop it! Stop it right now or I'll get Officer Whitmore! Riff lets go. Cindy, crying, runs into her tent. Everyone silent. Then:
(to Angela) So, Maria, what's your favorite color?
SCREAMING. Then she LAUGHS.

We see that everyone is busy cleaning. Tony scrubs the gr while Greg, using a plastic tub, washes various cooking u Greg hands the utensils to Marsha, who rinses them in a s tub. Marsha then hands the clean utensils to Anita, who d them. Barney in the b.g. picks up a pile of wood, crosses campers and sets it down.
I think Tony scared the raccoon half to death! (to Tony) Come on. Scream again! I want to hear it! Tony turns toward Barney.
(mock angry) Barney, this rich white girl keeps giving me a hard timel
Oh, poor babyl Everyone LAUGHS.
(to Barney) I hate to bring this up. But what do you think happened to that Angela Baker?
Nobody knows. There's no pictures of her since 7 years ago. Plus when she was 18 her juvenile records were destroyed. All we can go on are descriptions.
But she was a counselor here last year. Didn't anyone take her picture?
Nope. Supposedly nobody wanted to. She wasn't very popular.
What does she look like?
She's white. About 5 foot 7, 115 pounds. Brown eyes. Reddish brown hair. Twenty-one years old.
What would you do if you saw her? Pause.
(matter of factly) I'd kill her.
All right, everyone. Let's put our differences aside and try to move on,
Lilly, with four long strips of heavy cloth, stands befor Angela, Cindy, Bobby, and Riff. None look too excited.
We're going to do a trust game right now. Let's break up into pairs. Cindy glares at Riff, then turns to Angela. Riff gives Ci attitude and turns to Bobby. Bobby gives it his best shot
(to Riff) Looks like we're partners.
Shut up.
Cool, man. Right on. Lilly hands two strips of cloth each to Cindy and Bobby.
One of you will be blindfolded and have your hands tied behind your back. Your partner will then lead you around. After fifteen minutes or so, you'll switch.
Oh, this'll be fun. (to Angela) You can go first.
Angela, blindfolded, gets led through the woods by Cindy. pays little attention to her.
How you doin', honey?
Okay.
Good. I wish I could say the same. That nigger could've killed me. She shudders.

I bet he would've liked that, too. He could brag to all his Гўв‚¬Е“"homeboys" how he massacred some rich white girl. Those street  gangs do that, you know. Cindy LAUGHS and stops. Angela keeps walking, unaware tha has stopped. Angela bumps into a tree. Cindy LAUGHS and catches up to
Be a good girl, and just stay there a second. I'll be right back. Cindy walks several feet away.
Hey -
SIGHING, she sits down and pulls a gold cigarette case ou jeans. She opens up the case, takes out a cigarette and l it. Cindy inhales the cigarette as if it were the last sh ever smoke.
very uncomfortable and more than a little ticked off.
as it approaches Angela.
The rabbit looks around. Studies Angela. Then starts to c Angela's leg. Angela SCREAMS and kicks the rabbit off.
She puts out the cigarette and crossing back to Angela.
What's wrong?
(yelling) Something was crawling on me! The rabbit has long since disappeared.
I don't see anything.
Get this blindfold off! Cindy, laughing to herself, removes the blindfold. Angela get used to the light as Cindy unties her wrists.
Honey, I'm sure it was nothin.' You city kids have just gotta get used to the country. Angela gives Cindy one of her famous looks.
Your turn.
Angela leads the blindfolded and tied Cindy out of the wo the main camp area.
Where are we?
It's a surprise.
Well, I'm gettin' tired. And my feet hurt.
I thought you country girls were used to this kind of stuff.
Hah. Hah.
Are you a cheerleAder?
Yes.
Figures. Are you a virgin?
No!
Do you take drugs?
Doesn't everybody?
Strike three. Angela stops at the camp flag pole.
It's about time we stopped. Take this stuff off me right now. Silence.
Did you hear me? Nothing.
Oh, I get it. You're leavin' me now.

head_text.subj: A METAL FLAG FASTENER ATTACHED TO THE FLAGPOLE R

text: being hooked onto one of Cindy's back belt loops. Cindy laughs.
(mimicking Angela) Help! Somethin's on Me! Her face begins to lift out of frame.
(confused) Hey -
Angela begins hoisting Cindy up the flagpole.
Angela, ignoring her, turns Cindy around so Cindy's head the ground. Angela then reaches up and wraps the rope aro of Cindy's legs.
Angela starts hoisting her up again.
Angela hoists her to the top of the flagpole.

Because you're a cheerleader, a fornicator, a drug-taker, and a nasty, snotty bigot. Besides that, you're real nice. Angela lets go of the rope. Cindy drops to the bottom. Her head SMASHES into the cement surrounding the flagpole
Lilly cooks a larger juicy steak as Angela enters.
Where's Cindy?
At the main camp. She's got a headache.
Why don't you be a dear and get her? While you're at it, grab that sack of garbage by my tent. There's a place to dump it behind the dining hall. Ancela crosses to the garbage and picks it up.
Oh - I'm just about out of tanning lotion. There's some in the pantry right next to the kitchen. The front door should be open.
Did there used to be a cabin up here?
Yes. Right over there.  She points to the pile of boards.
Was that the cabin where all those bodies were found last year?
(surprised) How'd you know about that?
I guess I read about it.
Well, don't tell the others. They could get spooked. Angela starts to exit.
And hurry back. It's almost time for lunch.
Angela lifts up the doormat, finds the key and opens the
Angela enters, carrying the bag of garbage. She stops and looks at the empty hall.

Angela's flashbacks, like all memories, have been changed and wishful thinking. Angela seems prettier and more vibr we knew her to be. The CAMPERS in her memories are also m excited and cheerful than they actually were.
in a Camp Rolling Hills t-shirt. Very happy as she stands in front of the CROWDED dining h
Good morning, Campers!
(shouting) Good morning, Angela!
It's a wonderful day to be alive, isn't it?!
(shouting)
Angela turns and continues walking.
with her guitar, SINGING THE "HAPPY CAMPER SONG" with the CAMPERS, who enthusiastically CLAP as they sing.
(singing) Oh, I'm a Happy Camper! I love the summer sun, I love the trees and forests, I'm always having fun!
Now by the kitchen entrancer Angela stops and looks back more.
her "Counselor of the Week" ribbon pinned to her chest. H the ribbon is slightly bigger and prettier than it actual Angela brushes away a tear before she addresses the campe
As some of you know, I've gone through a lot of hard times in my life. I've been picked on.  Abused. And misunderstood more often than I can remember.
listening. They clearly love and respect her.
But that's what so terrific about places like this. We can learn to love one another.
Thanks for being such great kids. You've made this camp so much fun. I love you all. Everyone CHEERS as Angela smiles, laughs, and begins to c
You like me! You really, really like me!
Angela smiles and turns toward the kitchen.

PITCH BLACK until Angela opens the CREAKING DOOR and turn light. A MOUSE scurries across the floor. Angela slowly enters. it is obvious that the pantry, almo empty of supplies, is in dire neglect. Angela passes by a shelf containing old sports equipment preservers. Much of the equipment is damaged. Angela spots a bottle of sun tan lotion next to a cassett recorder in the "lost and found" section. Next to the tap recorder is a microphone and several tapes. Angela picks up the lotion, then wipes her finger across of the tape recorder. Angela looks at her finger. It's co with dirt and dust. A COCKROACH runs past hez hand. Angela SCREAMS and jumps back. She quickly crosses back t entrance. Hanging on a nail next to the light switch is a key ring with several keys.  Angela looks at the keys a moment. Then takes them.

Angela exits the dining hall's back door and the bag of g She looks for garbage cans, but there are none. Crossing a few feet from the back entrance, she spots a g pit about 4 feet wide. Next to it is a large pile of dirt shovel lays on top. Angela crosses to the pit and looks inside.
About 5 1/2 feet deep. SEVERAL RATS gnaw away at the rott garbage.
as she quickly throws the trash in the pit, and turns awa

Lilly HUMS to herself as she sets up a beach recliner. Bo packs up stones and tosses them into the woods while Riff ground, plays cards and listens to his RAP MUSIC. Angela, still disgusted by what she saw, enters and cross Lilly. She glares at Lilly as she hands her the tanning l
Thanks, dear. Is Cindy coming?
No. She's resting awhile in one of the cabins.
She's not supposed to. But, what can you do? Ready for another trust game?
I thought it was time to eat.
It almost is. Bobby, come over here, dear! Bobby crosses as Lilly grabs four pieces of rope.
I want you two to stand next to each other, side by side. They comply, and Lilly begins tying a rope around their w As she does:
I'm going to be tying you two together. You'll have to coordinate your walking, your hand movements, everything. Lilly starts tying the wrists of their inner hands togeth she turns to Riff.
Riff, since Cindy isn't feeling well, I think you and I will have to be partners.
No fucken way. Lilly lets it pass. Never argue with a juvenile delinquen
How long do we have to do this?
Until you've caught enough fish for lunch and dinner. It'll test how well you can work together.
But what about that steak you were cooking? Lilly starts tying their inner calves together.
That was mine. I'm allergic' to fish.
Staring angrily at Lilly.
Angela and Bobby, tied together, sit on the dock, next to are their fishing supplies.
Gimme the hook. Bobby does. Angela quickly baits the hook.
You're good at that.
That's what everybody says. Okay, cast. Bobby does his best, but it's not too great. Angela decid let it be. She turns to Bobby.
Why'd you come here?
It's a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Plus it looks great on my resume. He motions to the fishing pole.
Could you hold this a minute?
Sure. He gives her the fishing pole. Then turns toward her. And
You know something, Maria?
What?
I think you're nice.
Thanks.
Do you think I'm nice?
Yeah. I guess.
Good.  Beat.
Do you want to know something else?
What?

I like being tied up. Especially next to you. It turns me on. Angela tries not to look nauseated. Just as she is about to say something, Bobby attacks her, kissing her and fondling her breasts with his free hand. Angela drops the pole and slaps Bobby hard.
But I thought you wanted it. Your type always do.
No! Pause.
At least not now. She smiles.
Meet me by the dining hall right after dark. Bobby grins.
But how will we get away from Lilly?
Don't worry. I'll handle it.
lying on the recliner - eyes closed, sunning herself. A string of fish are shoved in front of her face. She frowns, then opens her eyes.
Angela, still tied to Bobby, holds the fish.
Good job! (beat) Why don't you put them down? Angela complies. Lilly gets out of her chair and begins t them. Lilly turns to a tent occupied by Riff. As dsual, his RAP blares in the b.g.
Riff! Since Maria and Bobby caught the fish, I think you should clean them. No answer. Lilly turns back to Angela and Bobby.
Bobby, maybe you should clean them.
But that's not fair. He doesn't do anything.
Let me talk to him. She crosses to the tent and opens the flap. Riff, hands b his head, lies on his sleeping bag.
Hi. Riff doesn't answer.
We just spent two hours catching fish. It's only fair that you clean them. RTFF TURNS UP HIS MUSIC FULL BLAST.
Please turn that down.
What? ANGELA (shouting) I said turn down your music.
What?
(shouting) You heard me the first time! Riff looks at her a moment. Turns down his music. Then pu pistol from behind his head and points it at her. Angela turns to Bobby.
Clean the fish, Bobby.
Marsha her hands tied and her eyes blindfolded, is led by through the woods.
This is easy. Make it harder.
Okay. He grabs her shoulders and starts leading her around, alm bumping her into several trees. She loves it. Tony then s spinning her around.
Stop it! I'm getting dizzy! Tony stops. Marsha wobbles to the ground. He sits next to
It's your turn.
Huh uh.
I'll tell!
Geez. I'm scared. He unties her, and takes off her blindfold.
So what's it like where you live? AS MARSHA STARTS TO SPEAK, Tony playfully interrupts.
No. Don't tell me. You go toa little red brick school. And you're in the choir.
It's orange brick. And I'm in the band.
Same difference. You've got really nice parents. And your town has a park where every Fourth of July there's fireworks. Plus at Christmas there's a big parade when Santa Claus arrives. Am I right?
Don't make fun of me!
And what have you been doing to me this whole weekend? MARSHA LAUGHS.
Are you in a gang?
Yeah. Where I'm from, everybody is.
What's it like?
You don't want to hear about it. I wish I could get out. But the only way to do that is to move.
Why don't you?
Maybe I will. I'll come live with you. In Idaho.
Ohio.
(in unison) Same difference. Pause.
Are you scared of me?
No. But I was.
You're very pretty.
(softly) Thanks. They look at each other. Smile.
Can I kiss you? She nods. He kisses her tentatively. Then tenderly. Marsha pushes away.
What's wrong?
Nothing. Marsha fishes into her pants pocket.
If we're gonna make love, you've gotta wear one of these.  She pulls out a wrapped condom. Tony reacts. Then:
I'm moving to Ohio! MARSHA LAUGHS, then they continue where they left off.
staring. Then crossing to Lilly, who sits in her beach recliner, r European travel magazine. In the b.g. Bobby and Riff eat fish and creamed corn.
Lilly- Let's do the blindfold game together. Lilly frowns.
Please? I'll lead you back to camp. That way you can check up on Cindy. Lilly puts down her magazine.
Why not? I was getting a little worried about her anyway. Let me get a couple strips of cloth. Angela produces two strips of cloth from behind her back.
I've got some. Angela smiles. Some would say angelically.
blindfolded, walking.
Angela leads the blindfolded and tied Lilly. As they talk, Angela leads Lilly in the direction of the trench behind the dining hall.
Are you planning a trip soon?
Yes. Herman and I are going to Europe. It'll be very expensive, but like Herman says, "we're worth it."
You have cockroaches in the pantry. And I think I sawa mouse.
Really? We'll have to do something about that.
Why do you bury your trash?
Because garbage companies charge an arm and a leg.
They're not that expensive.

Every penny counts. It hasn't been easy taking this place over, let me tell you. Nobody wants to go to a camp where everyone's been slaughtered. They arrive at the garbage pit, with Lilly directly in fr it.
Have you ordered your tickets to Europe yet?
No.
Good. Your trip's been canceled. Angela shoves Lilly into the pit. Only Lilly's head is a ground. Angela crosses to the shovel as Lilly struggles to get ou
No they won't. They'll be suffocated soon.
Angela, ignoring LILLY'S SCREAMS, SINGS while burying Lil her head.

(singing) Oh, I'm a Happy Camper! I love the summer sun, I love the trees and forests, I'm always having fun! Oh, I'm a Happy Camper! I love the clear blue sky, And with the Grace of God, I'll camp until I die! Lilly, except for her head, is completely buried.
Goodbye, Lilly. She begins to exit.
By the way, your husband fools around. Lilly, confused and frightened, yells at the exiting Ange
you can't leave me here! Come back! You're in big trouble No answer.
You little shit! Come back here  right now! Nothing.
Did you hear me? GET ME OUT OF
Silence, then:
Angela, pushing a large gas-powered lawnmower. Heading straight towards Lilly's head.
Realizing.
approaching.
calmly pushing the mower.
as the lawnmower quickly approaches.
as it almost reaches Lilly.
as Angela lifts the mower up so that the blades will atta Lilly's face.
turning rapidly.
as she brings the mower down on Lilly's head.
Blood and pieces of Lilly's head fly from the mower.
A pair of hands reach around and cover her eyes.
Guess who?
Bobby.
Angela sits under a tree. Bobby takes his hands away from face. He looks freshly groomed.
Yeah. How'd you know? He kisses her on the head. Angela gets up. Angela points to the tree.

Stand in front of the tree. Be does. On the cround next to the tree are two pieces of One is about three feet long. The other rope is wound in with one end trailing away from the tree. Angela takes the short piece of rope and ties Bobby's fee against the tree.
So you like to be tied up, huh? Bobby blushes.
Yeah. But don't tell anybody, okay? If the wrong person found out, I could lose an election someday.
My lips are sealed. Put your hands behind the tree.
Shouldn't I take my clothes off first?
No. It's more fun like this. He complies. Angela takes the end of the coiled rope and hands behind the tree.
Wow. This is like something in a dirty magazine. Wouldn't that be cool? Reading about this?
It's more fun to live it.
Yeah. He closes his eyes.
I really appreciate this. It's not like I don't respect you or anything. I do. I think you're really a neat person. He opens his eyes.
When do we screw?
Bobby looks around. No Angela. Turning around, he sees th Angela is about to enter Herman and Lilly's Jeep parked n
Whaddya doing?
(as she climbs in) Thank the Lord there will be one less idiot in politics. SHE GUNS THE MOTOR.
Angela speeds away in the Jeep. As she does, we see that tied to the Jeep's hitch. The very same rope that leads t coil ... and to Bobby.
Hey - The coil of rope quickly starts unraveling. Bobby notices
Bobby tries to quickly untie himself. But it's no use. The coil of rope soon disappears. The taut rope now yanks Bobby's arms back.
Bobby's arms RIP out of their sockets.

head_text.subj: A CENTERFOLD OF A BEAUTIFUL MODEL.

text: A tape cassette is flung on top of the picture.
Riff, noticing, picks it up. Studies it a moment. Then he and ejects the cassette PLAYING in his beat box. Be inser the.new one. Hits the play button.
FROM SOMEONE'S VOICE. Then:

(rapping) Angels are pretty, Angels can fly, And here's an angel That can make you die. You've got no style, You've got no flair, All you do Is fight and swear. So say your prayers And make amends, Cause your life story Is about to end. Silence.
What? The tent suddenly collapses around him.
We can see the outline of Riff's body as he crawls to the
(very angry) Fuckheads! I'll get you! His right hand reaches out.
as a tent stake is swiftly driven through it. Riff SCREAMS

Angela, towering over the collapsed tent, drives another into the tent where Riff's back arches out. Blood seeps through the cloth as Riff writhes and SCREAMS doesn't let up until his SCREAMS DIE OUT. Silence. Angela gives the stake one last pound for good luck. Then calmly crosses over to her tent and enters. Finally ready good night's sleep.
kissing by the side of a tent. Marsha looks up. Sees:
glaring at them.
Marsha startled, stops kissing Tony. Tony, confused, look also sees Angela. Angela carries her sleeping bag and sui
(to Angela) Hello. Ignoring him, Angela crosses to Barney, who plays frisbee Greg and Anita. Tony and Marsha curious, get up and follo behind.
(to Angela) Can we do something for you?
Yeah. Herman wants me to be in this group. I'm supposed to switch. With Marsha. THE CAMPERS VOICE THEIR SURPRISE AND DISAPPOINTMENT.
Angela silently leads the way as Barney and Marsha walk b her. They walk down a very narrow path next to the edge o hill.
Our group was so good, too.
Maybe, if I talk with Herman, you can stay. But it's not my camp, so we've got to do what he wants. Besides, we're all getting together tomorrow anyway .
I know. But even so. Tonight was going to be special.
With us? Or with Tony? Marsha, embarrassed, LAUGHS. Angela, jealous and angry, turns and looks at Marsha. Marhsa looks at her and smiles. Then notices:
Maria, look out - Too late. Anaela trips over a root in the path. Marsha rushes over side.
Are you all right? Angela tries not to cry.
It hurts. Marsha, concerned, turns toward Barney.
What'1ll we do?
Cut it off.
(surprised) I'm joking.

head_text.subj: A FIRST AID KIT ATTACHED TO THE WALL

text: Mostly empty. A hand reaches for an ace bandage.
as Barney takes the bandage and crosses to Angela, sittin table with her shoe off. Marsha stands next to her, holdi hand.
You're lucky we've got this. The first aid kit was pretty empty.
What a surprise. Barney starts bandaging the ankle.
It's not too bad. You'll just have to stay off of it as much as possible. Marsha strokes Anaela's hair.
Feel better?
Yeah. Thanks a lot. I mean it. Marsha smiles. Maria's a little strange. But she's okay.
I'd better go find Herman.
How well do you know him?
Not very well.
Good. Cause he's a terrible counselor. So's Lilly.
They're not so bad.
They eat steak while we eat fish. He fornicates with the campers. And Lilly's so lazy, she doesn't do anything. Just sits all day and sunbathes.
How do you know?
I have eyes.  Beat.
Did Herman really want Marsha to switch with you, or did you just make that up? Pause.
I made it up. I want to be with you guys.
Sorry, Maria. We've got to stick to the rules. You should get back to Herman.
But I don't want to.
It's only for another day. Come on. We'll help you walk there. They help her off the table.
Does Lilly really sunbathe all day?
Yeah. In fact, she's out in the back right now.
Really?
Go look for yourself. But I'm warning you, it's not a pretty sight. MARSHA GIGGLES.
(to Barney) Can 1?
Go ahead. But don't laugh in her face.
I won't! Marsha exits towards the kitchen.
Marsha looks through the window, but can't see anything. opens the door and enters into the back area. She turns to the garbage pit. Nothing. Disappointed she turns back. Spots something.
facing away from her.
as she smiles and creeps toward the chair. Crossing almos it, she peeks over the edge.
lying on the chair. Covered with dirt and crawling with r
Marsha 0.S. SCREAMING carries into the hall. Barney runs to the kitchen area as Marsha stumbles in, ho crying, speechless.
What's wrong? Marsha points in the direction of the back door. Barney exits toward the door.
(to Marsha) It seems everytime I go to camp, somebody loses their head. Marsha stares at Angela.
I knew a girl last year that reminds me of you. Her name was Molly. She was really nice. Too bad she's dead. Barney, 0.S., SHOUTS TO MARSHA.
Marsha get out of herel Run to the highway!
(hurt) No! Stay. Marsha in shock, doesn't move. Barney re-enters.
(to Marsha)
Marsha runs out the back. Barney turns to Angela. Angela GIGGLES.
When you get mad you look just like your son. Barney picks up a folding chair and starts crossing slowl towards Angela. He will kill her, or die trying. But he w
(calmly) How many have you killed this time?
I don't know. Lots. But I had no choice. They deserved it.
You gonna kill me, too? Angela nods. He keeps advancing.
So how you gonna do it? A knife? A drill? A chainsaw? Angela says nothing.
Fire? Acid? or maybe you're going to boil me in water like you did that cook seven years ago. Come on, Angela. What's it gonna be? Silence. Then:
A gun. She produces Riff's gun from behind her back and FIRES.
as the bullet hits him squarely in the forehead.
as Angela fires the remaining five rounds into Barney.
Marsha terrified and crying, runs down the road. SFX: A CAR ENGINE IN THE DISTANCE. Marsha turns around to see Barney's Mustang coming from c She stops. Then sees as the car gets closer:
She runs off the road into the woods.

Angela veers the Mustang off the road and follows Marsha woods. Running over small trees and bushes, the Mustang soon cat  to Marsha almost pinning her against a tree. Marsha starts crying uncontrollably. Angela gets out of the car and crosses to Marsha
We're gonna have so much fun together. Just wait. Angela strokes Marsha's hair. Horrified, Marsha pulls awa Angela reacts.
Don't make me hurt you.
Tony, Anita and Greg, sit in front of a tent. Tony stands
I think we should go look for them.
Me, too.
But Barney told us to wait. Maybe it's some kind of a test.
They left three hours ago, man.
Hello. They turn.
at the edge of camp. She crosses with a slight limp over group.
Barney wants to see all of us at the main camp. Marsha's there, too. We're supposed to play a trust game together.
Where have you guys been?
It's a long story.

Greg, Tony and Anita stand next to each other in front of cabins. Tony and Greg s inner legs and arms have already tied together with rope; their arms tied behind their bac and Anitta's inner arms have also been tied together behi backs. Angela finishes tying Tony and Anita's inner legs as they talk.
(to Angela) How come you don't have to be tied up?
Cause Barney said so.
When's he getting here?
I told you. Anytime now.
This is bullshit.
Don't swear. It'll be fun.
Says your mama. Angela finishes tying them up.
Good. All set. She crosses to a nearby tree. A rope hangs from the tree, a low branch. Angela looks o.s.
Here comes Barney now. The others look o.s.
Where?
I thought I saw him. Never mind. Angela turns in the opposite direction.
Is that him? They turn. Nothing.
Nope. Just my eyes playing tricks on me, I guess. She takes a knife out of her back pocket, then looks up.
Oh. There he is. She cuts the rope with the knife.
Barney's bloody body, tied to the rope, falls from the tr hangs in front of them. Greg, Tony and Anita SCREAM.
Barney! Thanks for dropping in. She turns to the group.

Time to play. The object of this game is to stay alive. The rules are simple. Marsha is in one of the three cabins before you. Is she in Cabin Number One I Cabin Number Two, or Cabin Number Three? You have exactly two minutes to find out. If you try to run away, I'll kill you. if you don't find her, I'll kill you. And if you try to hurt me in anyway, I'll kill you. Any questions? The three, terrified, say nothing.
Fine. Good luck!  She looks at her watch.
On your mark ... get set ... go! They don't move. Angela crosses to them, brandishing her
You think I'm joking? She slashes the knife across Greg's cheek. Blood starts s through the cut.
I'm dead serious. And you've just lost fifteen seconds.
She'll kill us! Let's go! Greg, Tony and Anita struggle to the first cabin, climb t stairs and enter.
Shining their flashlight in the dark cabin, the three qui cross to a form under the covers of one of the beds.
Marsha! Greg pulls back the cover. Jan. Burnt to a crisp. They react, and turn to the bathroom.
Marsha!
They enter and see:
propped up on the bathroom counter. Her skull smashed; he covered in blood. Hysterical, they exit.
The three head for the counselor's room. They open the d
Lying against the wall. Like Jan, burnt. Unlike Jan, his blown off.
Angela checks her watch as the three exit the cabin and h the second cabin.
A minute and a half to go! They quickly enter the second cabin.
The three enter and almost stumble over Snowboy's torched laying on the floor. Anita SCREAMS. They open the counselor's door. Riff, hanging from above the door, swings down in front o
I can't take it! We've gotta stop!
No! They move on to the bathroom. A severed arm hangs from th doorway.
They enter to find another severed arm on the floor. Bobb bloody, armless body is propped up in the corner.
They exit. All three have gone over the edge. They head for the third cabin: Angela's old cabin from la
Two down. One to go. You've got forty seconds left.
Greg, Tony, and Anita enter. The room is empty.
Marsha! Silence. Then, from the counselor's room, they HEAR CRYIN
Marsha! They rush to the door. Just as they open it:
In the middle of the room. Her arms and legs hogtied with Berman's burnt corpse leans against one side of her. Lill decapitated cadaver leans against the other.

A hatchet and a double-edged ax, tied to ropes and weight bricks, swiftly swing down from the top of the doorway. The ax hits Anita in her chest. The hatchet hits Greg in his abdomen. Blood gushes from their wounds. Tony and Marsha horrified beyond belief, react. Dying, their bodies slump. Tony struggles to support thei weight.
Angela enters.
Congratulations. You made it. With seven seconds to go. You're both nice kids. If you ask me, the other two were kinda boring.  She turns.
I've got to be going. The phone lines have been cut. But there's a pay phone at a little store about three miles from here. She crosses to the cabin door. Then turns back to Tony.
I have to admit, I had a crush on you. But you and Marsha look good together. And as my aunt always said, "there's plenty of fish in the sea." Bye. She exits. Tony drops down to Marsha.
Marsha - But Marsha doesn't hear him. With all her strength, she l hogtied legs and arms up in the air. Then brings them swiftly down on the double-edged ax wedg Anita's body. The ropes slice in two.
as she walks toward the Jeep. SFX: A WOMAN SCREAMING. Angela turns around.
SCREAMING AT THE TOP OF HER LUNGS and brandishing the ax, runs straight towards Angela.
Angela, terrified, runs with all her might. But her ankle slows her down.

Marsha chases Angela. Angela runs faster. Angela falls, but somehow manages to and run again. Marsha catches up and swings the ax at Angela. She misses Angela tries to get away, but Marsha gives the ax another and hits Angela in the arm. The ax falls. Angela, holding her arm, falls to the ground. Marsha goes for the ax. Angela trips her. Angela, with her knife, stabs Marsha across the leg. She tries to stab her again, but Marsha grabs the knife.
Marsha still SCREAMING, stabs Angela repeatedly in the to
Stop it, Marsha! Stop it! Marsha looks up. She breaks down, CRYING BITTERLY.
(whispering) You try to be nice to someone, and look what happens. Her eyes close.
Speeding down the road, SIREN BLARING.
A POLICEMAN drives. Tony and Marsha sit in the back. Both bandaged.  Silence, then Tony turns to Marsha.
(tenderly) You okay? Marsha nods.
You sure?
(softly) Yeah.
I love you so much. Marsha weakly smiles. He kisses her an the forehead.
Everything's gonna be fine. I'll move to Ohio. We can be together forever. We'll get married.
Tony -
Yeah?
I kinda already have a boyfriend. Beat.
But you can always visit. On Tony's reaction:
An ambulance, with lights and SIREN, speeds down the road
Angela, eyes closed, lies on a gurney. She is covered in bandages. An I.V. is connected to her arm. A FAT PARAMEDI watches her on one side, A REDNECK POLICEMAN on the other STERN-LOOKING MAN drives.
She's still alive.
(to paramedic) Let's kill her. Nobody'1l know.
I dunno...
Come on. She doesn't deserve to live.
It'd be easy to do. Angela's eyes open.
It'd put a stop to all of this. It's gotta end sometime.
as Angela rips it out.
as Angela stabs the policeman in the heart with the hypo.
as the hypo is stabbed deep into his eye. Then into his neck.
laying back down on the gurney.
Hey! What's happening back there?
(whispering) Just taking care of business. She smiles. And shuts her eyes. FADE OUT.

(rapping) Angels are pretty, Angels can fly, And here's an angel That can make you die. You've got no style, You've got no flair, All you do Is fight and swear. So say your prayers, And make amends, Cause your life story Is about to end.

head_text.subj: LOUD, FRIGHTENING MUSIC BEGINS AND CONTINUES DURING THE R
